title: What part of speech is the word 'sore'? - Quora

response.answer_text: Hi! The word ‘sore’ is generally used as parts of speech in the form of an adjective or noun. Sore feeling.Soreness.Dull pain.Hurt.All these words can be used to describe anguish and misery. I have an aching head.My head hurts.I have a pain in my head.I have a sore head.I have an aching heart.Adjectives may be, sorer or sorest. Something physically painful or sensitive, like a wound, hurt, or diseased part, e.g a sore arm. suffering mental pain; grieved, distressed, or sorrowful: to be sore at heart. Sentences could be: The man has a sore throat. That's a sorer subject that the previous one. The topic touched on the sorest spot. My friend is sore at me. Thanks!

Sore when it means painful is an adjective describing a noun. ‘ A sore head. A sore back. ‘ Sore when it means your feelings have been hurt. ‘I am hurt, I am sore at the rude way he treated my sister.’
